result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant James M. Pelky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Report no later than 12-7-15 by 6:00 pm
Huber privileges
Consecutive to: to 13CF216

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: No crimes to level of probable cause and complete probation, if complies will be dismissed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M. Pelky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court calls  @ 2:24 pm.  Defendant James M. Pelky not in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court gives history of case. State moves to dismiss ct 2.  Court will grant request and dismiss ct 2.
Copy hand delivered to SD, Copy to Def.
On def's failure to pay the fine, Court orders 45 days jail, 5 days on 15-CF-123 and 40 days on 15-CF-210.

Defendant James M. Pelky in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF210 & 13CF216 @ 11:35 am.  State gives agreement, 13CF216, Ct 1 DJ Revoked, withheld sentence 2 years probation, counseling by agent, costs, 15CF210, Plea to ct 1, 60 days jail, huber, Ct 2 Dismissed, costs on ct 1, 15CF123 State will not revoke DJ. Atty Dodge agrees with plea agreement.  Def. agrees to plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  15CF210, Def. understand charge & penalties, Def. is confused.  Atty Dodge makes statement and is wondering if def. is confused.  Def. would like to request an adjournment.  Def. reported 3 days late. Def. had oral surgery. Court will give def. a week or two to report to jail.  Court will try to keep going.  Court goes over Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Right. Court is not comfortable going forward. Court is going to adjourn matter.  Plea Questionnaire given back to Atty Dodge.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
On def's failure to pay the fine, Court orders 30 days jail.

ADDRESS INFO for James M. Pelky
Current: 1130 Fifth Ave., Apt 1, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 10-22-2015)
Prior: 629 Irving Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant James M. Pelky in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 9:21am  Cases called 15CF123 and 13CF216.  Waiver of preliminary  13CF216 Plea to Ct 1 & 2.  Ct 1 Deferred jmt.  Ct 2 Probation, 22 days jail cost.  15CF123 Plea to both counts.  Ct 1 - cost, 30 days jail consecutive to 13CF216 Ct 2 - Deferred jmt.  Parties agree to plea agreement.  15CF123 Court explains right to preliminary hearing.  Waiver signed.  Court will accept waiver of preliminary.  Information filed.  Received, waive reading.   Parties are ready to proceed to plea sentencing.  Plea advisement form signed and reviewed.  13CF216 Retail theft - No contest plea Ct 1 No contest.  15CF123 - Ct 1 No contest plea and Ct 2 - No contest plea.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements of charges reviewed.  Repeater and domestic abuse enhancer reviewed.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for pleas, pleas accepted for 13CF216 Ct 1 Judgment deferred  15CF123 Ct 2 Jmt deferred.  Found guilty 13CF216 Ct 2 and 15CF123 Ct 1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Victim rights have been complied with.  13CF216  $200.00 bond and 15CF123 $100.00 bond.  DNA sample and surcharge explained to def.  Atty Bayne-Allison presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.    13CF216 Ct 1 Deferred judgment 18 months, no crimes to probable cause and complete all probations, then will be dismissed.  Ct 2 - Sentence withheld 9 mo probation  Cost and counseling as required.  22 days jail report no later than 11-7-15.  Court cost only  Bond to be applied to 15CF123.  No credit.  15CF123 Ct 2 Deferred judgment for 18 months with same conditons.  No crimes and complete probation.  Ct 1 Sentence to 30 days jail Report no later than 12-7-15 at 6:00pm  Consecutive to 13CF216  Cost assessed, includes DNA surcharge.  DNA sample  No credit   13CF216   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights  Bond in 15CF123 to be applied to cost.  Huber privileges.  Payment plan   Review hearing set for 4-25-17 at 1:00 pm

Defendant James M. Pelky in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Issue of bond in regards to condition.  No contact provision.  Amended to no violent contact, abusive or profane contact.   Time limits waived for preliminary.  Copy of minutes to SD  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
